Class ec.ifc.stonelook.SLWindow 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.ExternalWindow
           |
           +----ec.ifc.app.ECExternalWindow
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.stonelook.SLWindow
public class SLWindow
extends ECExternalWindow
implements Target
Subclass of ExternalWindow that uses the stone-texture look.

SLWindow(int, int, int, int)
Creates a new title-bar-less external window with the stone-texture look.
SLWindow(int, int, int, int, int)
Creates a new external window with the stone-texture look.

getBorderedView()
Returns a container view positioned inside the stylish window border.
getCloseBox()
Returns the button used as a close box for this window, if this window has a close box, or null otherwise.
getContainerView()
Returns a container view positioned inside the stylish window border.
getHasCloseBox()
Returns whether this window has a close box.
getTitleImage()
Returns the title image for this window.
layoutWindow(View, int, int)
Repositions the container views in the window to fit the window's size.
performCommand(String, Object)
Processes "hide window" commands sent by close box.
setHasCloseBox(boolean)
Sets whether this window has a close box, and redraws appropriately.
setTitleImage(Image)
Sets the title image for this window.
show()
Overridden to draw immediately after showing, to avoid annoying period of time in which white rectangle lingers on screen.

SLWindow 
  public SLWindow(int x,
                  int y,
                  int contentWidth,
                  int contentHeight)
Creates a new title-bar-less external window with the stone-texture look. The parameters specify the initial position and the size of the window not counting the fancy border. The window has a close box by default, and uses the standard Microcosm window title image.
See Also:
setHasCloseBox, setTitleImage
SLWindow 
  public SLWindow(int windowType,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int contentWidth,
                  int contentHeight)
Creates a new external window with the stone-texture look. The parameters specify the initial position and the size of the window not counting the fancy border. The window has a close box by default, and uses the standard Microcosm window title image.
Parameters:
windowType - either Window.BLANK_TYPE or Window.TITLE_TYPE
See Also:
setHasCloseBox, setTitleImage

getCloseBox 
  public Button getCloseBox()
Returns the button used as a close box for this window, if this window has a close box, or null otherwise.
getBorderedView 
  public SLWindowContainerView getBorderedView()
Returns a container view positioned inside the stylish window border. You should pnly use this if you want to change the characteristics of the entire window, e.g. not have a texture on an SL window.
getContainerView 
  public ContainerView getContainerView()
Returns a container view positioned inside the stylish window border. Additional window subviews should be added as subviews of this view. If you treat this like a root view you will be happy and prosper.
getHasCloseBox 
  public boolean getHasCloseBox()
Returns whether this window has a close box. The close box is drawn imbedded in the border at a standard position.
See Also:
setHasCloseBox
getTitleImage 
  public Image getTitleImage()
Returns the title image for this window. The title image is drawn in the thick right side of the blue window border.
layoutWindow 
  public void layoutWindow(View view,
                           int deltaWidth,
                           int deltaHeight)
Repositions the container views in the window to fit the window's size. Couldn't use the default ResizeInstruction system due to IFC problems when the dialog would temporarily shrink to 0 height
performCommand 
  public void performCommand(String command,
                             Object data)
Processes "hide window" commands sent by close box.
Overrides:
performCommand in class ExternalWindow
setHasCloseBox 
  public void setHasCloseBox(boolean newValue)
Sets whether this window has a close box, and redraws appropriately.
See Also:
getHasCloseBox
setTitleImage 
  public void setTitleImage(Image newImage)
Sets the title image for this window.
See Also:
getTitleImage
show 
  public void show()
Overridden to draw immediately after showing, to avoid annoying period of time in which white rectangle lingers on screen.
Overrides:
show in class ExternalWindow
